Package com.eng.game.pathfinding.pathfinding.grid

Class NavigationGrid<T extends NavigationGridGraphNode>

java.lang.Object
com.eng.game.pathfinding.pathfinding.grid.NavigationGrid<T>
Type Parameters:
T - only classes extending GridCell can be used within this graph
All Implemented Interfaces:
NavigationGridGraph<T>, NavigationGraph<T>
public class NavigationGrid<T extends NavigationGridGraphNode>
extends java.lang.Object
implements NavigationGridGraph<T>
A NavigationGraph which is represented as a grid or a table. The nodes are accessible through (x, y) coordinates.

  • Field Details

    • width

      protected int width

    • height

      protected int height

    • nodes

      protected T extends NavigationGridGraphNode[][] nodes
      The nodes contained in the grid. They are stored as Grid[x][y]

  • Constructor Details

    • NavigationGrid

      public NavigationGrid()
      Creates an grid with no nodes. If this constructor is used, make sure to call setNodes(NavigationGridGraphNode[][]) before trying to make use of the grid cells.

    • NavigationGrid

      @Deprecated public NavigationGrid​(T[][] nodes)
      Deprecated.
      Constructs the grid by using the given nodes.

      This is the old way to biuld the grid, which now just calls NavigationGrid(T[][] nodes, boolean) with autoAssignXY = false. Kept only for compatibility with older vesions.

      Parameters:
      nodes - the ready-to-use nodes

    • NavigationGrid

      public NavigationGrid​(T[][] nodes, boolean autoAssignXY)
      Constructs the grid by using the given nodes. If autoAssignXY == true, the grid will automatically assign x, y values, under the assumption that nodes[0][0] is the lower left corner of the grid. 
         -----------------------
  |  0,2        |       |  2,2  |
   -----------------------
  |      |       |       |
   -----------------------
  |  0,0        |       |  2,0  |
   -----------------------
      Parameters:
      nodes - the nodes which compose the graph. Can be null if you plan to set the nodes later
      autoAssignXY - wetherTo automatically assign coordinates to your nodes

    • isWalkable

      public boolean isWalkable​(int x, int y)
      Determine whether the node at the given position is walkable.
      Specified by:
      isWalkable in interface NavigationGridGraph<T extends NavigationGridGraphNode>
      Parameters:
      x - - The x / column coordinate of the node.
      y - - The y / row coordinate of the node.
      Returns:
      true if the node at [x,y] is walkable, false if it is not walkable (or if [x,y] is not within the grid's limit)

    • contains

      public boolean contains​(int x, int y)
      Determine wether the given x,y pair is within the bounds of this grid
      Specified by:
      contains in interface NavigationGridGraph<T extends NavigationGridGraphNode>
      Parameters:
      x - - The x / column coordinate of the node.
      y - - The y / row coordinate of the node.
      Returns:
      true if the (x,y) is within the boundaries of this grid

    • setWalkable

      public void setWalkable​(int x, int y, boolean walkable)
      Set whether the node on the given position is walkable.
      Specified by:
      setWalkable in interface NavigationGridGraph<T extends NavigationGridGraphNode>
      Parameters:
      x - - The x / column coordinate of the node.
      y - - The y / row coordinate of the node.
      walkable - - Whether the position is walkable.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the coordinate is not inside the grid.

    • getNeighbors

      public java.util.List<T> getNeighbors​(T cell)
      Specified by:
      getNeighbors in interface NavigationGraph<T extends NavigationGridGraphNode>
      Parameters:
      cell - the node to find the neighbors for
      Returns:
      a list with all the adjacent nodes for the passed node, using the default options

    • getNeighbors

      public java.util.List<T> getNeighbors​(T node, PathFinderOptions opt)
      Get the neighbors of the given node. 
           offsets      diagonalOffsets:
  +---+---+---+    +---+---+---+
  |   | 0 |   |    | 4 |   | 5 |
  +---+---+---+    +---+---+---+
  | 3 |   | 1 |    |   |   |   |
  +---+---+---+    +---+---+---+
  |   | 2 |   |    | 6 |   | 7 |
  +---+---+---+    +---+---+---+
      Specified by:
      getNeighbors in interface NavigationGraph<T extends NavigationGridGraphNode>
      Parameters:
      node -
      opt -
      Returns:
      a list containing the adjacent nodes for the passed node, using the passed options

    • setNodes

      public void setNodes​(T[][] nodes, boolean autoAssignXY)
      Sets the grid nodes. If autoAssignXY == true, the grid will automatically assign x, y values, under the assumption that nodes[0][0] is the lower left corner of the grid. 
         -----------------------
  |  0,2        |       |  2,2  |
   -----------------------
  |      |       |       |
   -----------------------
  |  0,0        |       |  2,0  |
   -----------------------
      Parameters:
      nodes - the nodes which compose the graph. Can be null if you plan to set the nodes later
      autoAssignXY - wetherTo automatically assign coordinates to your nodes
